item.title: Would anyone by any chance know?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

What you want to do complicates things quite a bit, at least if you want to emulate the notion of a wilderness level.
You need to keep track of each safe zone. When calculating the level, you then need to obtain the nearest safe zone and use it to calculate the distance from the player.
This number can then be used to determine the wilderness level.

You could choose to only have some safe zones count as being ‘nearest’ so that you can have safe zones right within very deep wilderness.

Read full topic
item.source: Would anyone by any chance know?

item.title: Would anyone by any chance know?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

First off this should be in the help section. Other than that it’s a simple math formula that determines the value of ‘wild’

[quote=“Rsclassic2013, post:3, topic:519308”]I’m having trouble…this is how it looks like…What do I do to change the coords?

public int wildernessLevel() {
	int [b]wild[/b] =[b] 2203 - (y + (1774 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this))));[/b]
	if(x + 2304 >= 2640) {
		[b]wild [/b]= -50;
	}
	if([b]wild[/b] > 0) {
            	return 1 + [b]wild[/b] / 6;
            }
            return 0;
}

public boolean inWilderness() {
	return wildernessLevel() > 0;
}[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Would anyone by any chance know?

item.title: Would anyone by any chance know?
item.dc:creator: @Rsclassic2013 Rsclassic2013
item.description:
@Rsclassic2013 wrote:

[quote=“matty matt, post:2, topic:519308”]yes it would be in the point.java bro

edit: once in the file you will see exactly where you can change coords and such :)[/quote]

I’m having trouble…this is how it looks like…What do I do to change the coords?

public int wildernessLevel() {
	int wild = 2203 - (y + (1774 - (944 * Formulae.getHeight(this))));
	if(x + 2304 >= 2640) {
		wild = -50;
	}
	if(wild > 0) {
            	return 1 + wild / 6;
            }
            return 0;
}

public boolean inWilderness() {
	return wildernessLevel() > 0;
}

Read full topic
